intro: Bignonia prieurii, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a deciduous climbing vine that produces showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant has compound leaves with three to five ovate leaflets and is known for its rapid growth habit. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often used in ornamental gardening. The flowers attract pollinators like hummingbirds and bees, contributing to its ecological value.
